author: Ana Dib
description: 3D Multi-Temporal Monitoring of Vineyards Using Mobile Robotic Systems. This research aims to develop a cutting-edge system for 3D multi-temporal monitoring of vineyards, focusing on key vineyard features such as vine crops, grape clusters, and structural elements of the vineyard. Utilizing sensors such as cameras and GPS, the system identifies and models each vine row in 3D, enabling precise detection, localization, and re-identification of individual grape clusters weekly. This approach captures critical changes in grape development and vine health throughout different phenological stages and seasonal cycles. To enhance functionality, a robotic arm integrated with a mobile robot facilitates targeted observation and data acquisition, ensuring detailed monitoring of essential features. This work supports precision viticulture by offering advanced tools for analyzing crop dynamics and optimizing vineyard management.

author: Enso Ndreko
description: 1. The Beyond the Sea enterprise led by Yves Parlier, seeks the usage of tethered kites as a sustainable propulsion solution for vessels. This study explores a Lagrangian rigid body model that closely replicates a real-life experimental setup on the beach, incorporating parameters with physical significance and accounting for inertia effects. Keeping the kite in the desired part of the flying window is managed by guiding it along figure-eight trajectories, with adjustable parameters for position, size, and orientation. A trajectory-following control strategy is employed to ensure alignment to the desired path. The model‚Äôs accuracy and the effectiveness of the control methodology are qualitatively validated through simulations and animations of the kite‚Äôs takeoff and dynamic flight across various trajectories.

description: Caract√©risation et Mod√©lisation des Transistors SiGeHBT pour Performances Hautes Fr√©quences. Une mesure pr√©cise est essentielle pour comprendre les caract√©ristiques des dispositifs, faisant de leur caract√©risation une √©tape cruciale. Cette th√®se vise √† caract√©riser et mod√©liser les transistors bipolaires √† h√©t√©rojonction en silicium-germanium (SiGeHBT) afin d‚Äô√©valuer leurs performances en haute fr√©quence. L‚Äôapproche repose sur la mise en ≈ìuvre d‚Äôune proc√©dure d‚Äô√©talonnage utilisant un mod√®le d‚Äôerreur √† 16 termes, con√ßu pour √©liminer les erreurs syst√©matiques dans les mesures des param√®tres S. Ces donn√©es √©talonn√©es seront compar√©es √† des mesures radiofr√©quences (RF) ind√©pendantes et √† des simulations √©lectromagn√©tiques (EM) pour valider la pr√©cision de l‚Äô√©talonnage et √©valuer les performances en haute fr√©quence des dispositifs. Un substrat d‚Äô√©talonnage a √©t√© con√ßu √† l‚Äôaide du logiciel K-Layout, int√©grant diverses normes √† deux ports (par exemple, Load-Load, Load-Open) bas√©es sur les dimensions des substrats d‚Äô√©talonnage Cascade CS5 et CS15. Un plan d√©taill√©, regroupant toutes les structures con√ßues, garantit une m√©thodologie syst√©matique pour le design du substrat d‚Äô√©talonnage. Cette recherche contribue √† am√©liorer la pr√©cision des mesures RF pour les dispositifs semi-conducteurs miniaturis√©s, un aspect essentiel au d√©veloppement de composants √©lectroniques haute fr√©quence.
